author: Special Correspondent
text:
A spark in electrical circuit delayed the procession by 20 minutes

A large number of devotees witnessed the ‘Sandhanakoodu’ festival at Nagore dargah in the early hours of Saturday.

The holy sandal (sandanakoodu), mounted on a decorated vehicle, was taken through the thoroughfares in the town. A large number of devotees and pilgrims from different parts of the globe witnessed the procession.

On reaching the dargah, Sheik Hassan Sahib, managing trustee of the trust, received the ‘sandhanakoodu’ which was anointed to Nagore Andavar. The annual festival commenced with ‘Kandoori festival’ last month. Elaborate arrangements were made by the trust and the district administration for the smooth conduct of the festival. An uninterrupted power supply was ensured for the town all through the festival.

Spark

The procession was delayed by about 20 minutes following a spark in the electrical circuit of the decorated vehicle.

It was set right immediately.
title: Nagore sandhanakoodu festival draws large crowd
